FAILURES AND ARRANGEMENTS.
[It must be understood that the following items are simply announcements of failures. In a future issue we shall publish the names of the creditors and the amounts of their claims when the lists have been filed.]

BANKRUPTCY.
Road, Sheffield, builder. The liabilities have been returned at £1,300, and the assets officially estimated to produce £733 7d. leaving a deficiency of £566 13s. The cause of failure is stated to be bad debts. Official Receiver has been appointed trustee.
that the debtor commenced business as a builder at Sheffield about ten years ago, with a capital of £100, which his wife had saved prior to their marriage. The bankruptcy is attributed to bad debts, at which time he was a creditor for £1,000, cote, as a petitioning creditor for £50. a petition in bankruptcy was filed against Mr. George Buckley, W. Hall, J. Swinden, and paid a dividend of 1s. 9d. in the £. The following are the principal creditors:-
Buckley, W. Hall, J. Swinden, and Timmins, A. Swinden, Sheffield, £1,200. The bankrupt's bankers are also creditors.

COPE, A., builder, Sheffield. The debtor came up for his public examination on Saturday last at the County Court, Sheffield, before the Registrar (Mr. Joseph Binney). that he had been in business for about 14 years.
